channel.title: OATS Recent Changes
channel.description: Any changes to the OATSOFT site - including news, software additions, links etc...

item.title: Paint.NET
item.description: A free (not open source) accessible painting program with powerful tools.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: mouseTrap
item.description: mouseTrap is an application that intends to provide control of the mouse pointer using a Web Cam and face detection. The users can move the pointer using the face or other parts of it.
item.dc:creator: flaper87

item.title: Accerciser
item.description: Accerciser is an interactive Python accessibility explorer for the GNOME desktop. It uses AT-SPI to inspect and control widgets, allowing you to check if an application is providing correct information to assistive technologies and automated test frameworks.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: Orca
item.description: Orca is a free, open source, flexible, and extensible screen reader that provides access to the graphical desktop via user-customizable combinations of speech, braille, and/or magnification.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: formEdit and the Web Page Communicator Templates
item.description: The Web Page Communicator Templates are a set of Internet Explorer compatible web pages that are used to create web pages that behave similarly to dynamic display speech generating devices. Now many platforms capable of running Internet Explorer 4.0 or newer can be used as simple communications devices. The pages support multiple access methods including single switch and two switch scanning, linear or row-column scans, and auditory scanning. formEdit is a template editor that makes it easy to build a useful communications page using the Web Page Communicator templates. The current template set offers choice grids with 4 to 24 cells.
item.dc:creator: jimluther

item.title: Power Reader
item.description: A dyslexic text reader/learning tool, a graphical, interactive text reader integrated with computer text-to-speech whose level of focus, complexity, and detail is adjustable according to the user's needs.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: E-triloquist
item.description: The program has an input area on the screen for entering a text or audio phrase which is to be spoken or played. With the touch of the "Enter" key or a mouse click, the text is converted to speech and sent to a voice synthesizer which conveys the message in mellifluous tones. Audio phrases are played as recorded.
item.dc:creator: simonjudge

item.title: SymVoc
item.description: SymVoc is aimed to help less able people to communicate with others using symbols and speech synthesis.
item.dc:creator: rwjk

item.title: SteadyMouse
item.description: SteadyMouse is free software designed to assist people with the hand tremors that commonly go along with Parkinson's disease, Multiple sclerosis, etc.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: OpenEducationDisc
item.description: This software builds on the OpenDisc and is aimed directly at schools and students aged 10-21+ giving the necessary tools to help them complete homework/coursework assignments.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: at-spi
item.description: at-spi (assistive technology service provider interface) is the primary assistive technology infrastructure for the Solaris and Linux operating environments.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: gail
item.description: GAIL provides accessibility support for gtk+ by implementing AtkObjects for widgets in gtk+.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: atk
item.description: The interface definitions of accessibility infrastructure. (GNOME)
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: Mousetweaks 2.23.2
item.description: Mousetweaks provides mouse accessibility enhancements for the GNOME desktop.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: Hotspots
item.description: Hotspots is now open source and public domain or free software. It may be used by a number of users on one computer or by one user on a number of different computers.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: Game Accessibility Suite
item.description: Code library and utilities to enhance accessibility to existing and future games (Win32).
item.dc:creator: devellison

item.title: WordAid
item.description: WordAid is a lexical word listing program (as opposed to a word predictor) with text-to-speech support that can aid the development of literacy.
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: The periodic table enabling a pointer user to type chemical formuli - can be used with Efofex software Chem and Chem structure (upgraded 5/12/07)
item.dc:creator: dcolven

item.title: ICUTalk
item.description: ICUTalk was a research project, funded by the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC) from 1999 to 2002. The project developed an Augmentative and Alternative Communication (AAC) system to help patients in Intensive Care Units (ICU) who are temporarily unable to speak due to their medical condition or treatment, namely the intubation procedure. This was a multi-disciplinary collaborative project involving staff from the University of Dundee (School of Computing and the School of Nursing & Midwifery) and Ninewells Hospital, Dundee (Speech & Language Therapy and Intensive Care Unit). Andy Judson was the software developer and Professor Ian Ricketts was the primary investigator and Dr Annalu Waller was the secondary. The software has continued to be developed (although its been a wee bit slow), it remains in use in Ninewells Hospital, and there has been wider interest in it from around the world (not enough to warrant selling it though).
item.dc:creator: ajudson

item.title: SAW Resources
item.description: These resources are in continual development and will be updated from time to time. All contributions of new selection sets for SAW with be gratefully received.
item.dc:creator: dcolven
